body:
I noticed that we have no events from NodeController for some time now and I suspect this PR as this touches Event machinery. I see logs like:
```
Could not construct reference to: '&v1.ObjectReference{Kind:"Node", Namespace:"", Name:"gke-gke-large-deploy-default-pool-1-db034145-l952", UID:"a1c9fe9d-f1ce-11e6-ad7a-42010af00002", APIVersion:"", ResourceVersion:"", FieldPath:""}' due to: 'object does not implement the List interfaces'. Will not report event: 'Normal' 'RegisteredNode' 'Node gke-gke-large-deploy-default-pool-1-db034145-l952 event: Registered Node gke-gke-large-deploy-default-pool-1-db034145-l952 in NodeController'
```
I fixed the problem (using types from `pkg/api/v1` instead of `client-go/pkg/api/v1` when creating Event messages), but once I did this unit tests started to panic:
```
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x98 pc=0x12c3983]

goroutine 14 [running]:
panic(0x22ad7c0, 0xc420012150)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/.gvm/gos/go1.7.3/src/runtime/panic.go:500 +0x1ae
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/runtime.HandleCrash(0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/runtime/runtime.go:58 +0x17d
panic(0x22ad7c0, 0xc420012150)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/.gvm/gos/go1.7.3/src/runtime/panic.go:458 +0x271
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/rest.(*RESTClient).Verb(0x0, 0x248ac0c, 0x4, 0xc42011f501)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/rest/client.go:222 +0x63
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/rest.(*RESTClient).Post(0x0, 0x1f8)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/rest/client.go:232 +0x4e
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/typed/core/v1.(*events).CreateWithEventNamespace(0xc42019a600, 0xc420752200, 0xed033a0c6, 0x6, 0x43dd37)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/typed/core/v1/event_expansion.go:53 +0xfe
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/typed/core/v1.(*EventSinkImpl).Create(0xc4204f2460, 0xc420752200, 0xc42047a000, 0x30, 0x28)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/typed/core/v1/event_expansion.go:155 +0x60
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record.recordEvent(0x31a4160, 0xc4204f2460, 0xc420752200, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x405c00, 0xc42019a6a0, 0x2493bd7)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record/event.go:180 +0xec
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record.recordToSink(0x31a4160, 0xc4204f2460, 0xc4200fa000, 0xc42019a6a0, 0xc42019a640, 0x2540be400)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record/event.go:138 +0x1c8
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record.(*eventBroadcasterImpl).StartRecordingToSink.func1(0xc4200fa000)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record/event.go:120 +0xb7
k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record.(*eventBroadcasterImpl).StartEventWatcher.func1(0x3199f60, 0xc4204dc7e0, 0xc4204dc7b0)
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record/event.go:238 +0x127
created by k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record.(*eventBroadcasterImpl).StartEventWatcher
	/usr/local/google/home/gmarek/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/client-go/tools/record/event.go:240 +0x91
```

cc @deads2k @wojtek-t @piosz

title: Events in NodeController are not working
